provider.name: Ryan
provider.address: 2015 W Broadway St, Unit 3A, Ardmore, OK 73401

context: Month 16 of 24 post-Hansen bilateral rib reconstruction (Oct 11, 2024)
Hansen technique: Ribs 8-10 sutured to rib 7, reconstructing costal margin bilaterally
Dr. Hansen Jan 2025 CT: "Repair sites look good"
Critical collagen remodeling window: months 12-18 (we're IN IT)
Bioabsorbable PLLA/PLGA plates degrading via hydrolysis — biological fusion still forming
Hardware status: Plates degrading ("gravel-like" debris) — expected, but instability gap persists until biological fusion completes

concerns.title: Pectoral engagement severely limited (~2-3/10)
concerns.detail: Key recovery indicator; muscles guarding/spasming to protect unstable ribs

concerns.title: SICK scapula (left)
concerns.detail: Scapular malposition, inferior medial border prominence, coracoid pain, dyskinesis; documented labral tear + rotator cuff impingement

concerns.title: Compensatory guarding patterns
concerns.detail: 16 months of protection locking up movement; risk of becoming permanent

concerns.title: Kinetic chain dysfunction
concerns.detail: Right foot Jones fracture (5th met with screw) → Spiral Line fascial pathway → left ribs

morning: 15g collagen + 500mg Vitamin C + 20oz water before moving
Diaphragmatic reset: 10 min posterior rib breathing (crocodile position, 4-4-4 pattern)
Log roll exit from bed (no trunk rotation)
Peroneal release (R foot) — tennis ball under lateral foot, 2-3 min
Hip extension stretch — standing, 30sec x3 (releases psoas, stops anterior rib flare)
protocol.supplements: Collagen 15g AM, Vitamin C 1000mg/day (500 x2), Magnesium 400mg PM, 80oz+ water
protocol.restrictions: No spinal rotation >45°, no overhead reaching, no heavy lifting

exercises.name: Transverse abdominis activation
exercises.detail: Supine, knees bent, draw belly button to spine, hold 5s

exercises.name: Modified crocodile breathing
exercises.detail: Prone, towel under R foot, inhale 4ct into posterior ribs, exhale with R foot dorsiflexion

exercises.name: QL release
exercises.detail: Side-lying, foam roll L hip to ribs, pause at tender spots 30s, add contralateral arm reach

exercises.name: Wall angels
exercises.detail: Back against wall, arms at 90°, slide up/down maintaining contact, stop before compensation

exercises.name: Standing wood chops (light band)
exercises.detail: 3-5 lb, feet wide, R foot forward, chop high-R to low-L, rotation limited to 45°

questions: Pectoral engagement at ~2-3/10 — is this rib guarding, SICK scapula, or both?
Should we prioritize rib stabilization before aggressive shoulder PT, or parallel?
Would IASTM/ART be helpful before standard strengthening? (15+ months of adhesions — pec minor, conjoint tendon, clavipectoral fascia all likely fibrotic)
Spiral Line: right foot → left rib connection — should we address foot biomechanics?
Do you see classic SICK scapula presentation or secondary rib compensation?
Realistic pectoral engagement targets by month 18?
Home exercise program — continue Phase 1 or modify?
decompressionReset: Do NOT push rib back. Lie on R side → reach L arm overhead → deep breath into L flank → let gravity + breath reset → hold 2-3 min.

careTeam.name: Established
careTeam.note: Last: Feb 6 — need to schedule next
